title:
Beyond Idle Channels: Unlocking Idle Space with Signal Alignment in
  Massive MIMO Cognitive Radio Networks
authors: Weidong Zhu, Xueqian Li, Longwei Wang, Zheng Zhang
abstract:
Cognitive radio networks (CRNs) have traditionally focused on utilizing idle
channels to enhance spectrum efficiency. However, as wireless networks grow
denser, channel-centric strategies face increasing limitations. This paper
introduces a paradigm shift by exploring the underutilized potential of idle
spatial dimensions, termed idle space, in co-channel transmissions. By
integrating massive multiple-input multiple-output (MIMO) systems with signal
alignment techniques, we enable secondary users to transmit without causing
interference to primary users by aligning their signals within the null spaces
of primary receivers. We propose a comprehensive framework that synergizes
spatial spectrum sensing, signal alignment, and resource allocation,
specifically designed for secondary users in CRNs. Theoretical analyses and
extensive simulations validate the framework, demonstrating substantial gains
in spectrum efficiency, throughput, and interference mitigation. The results
show that the proposed approach not only ensures interference-free coexistence
with primary users but also unlocks untapped spatial resources for secondary
transmissions.
subjects: Electrical Engineering and Systems Science/Signal Processing
